intro: Shawia dentata, commonly known as the toothed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive toothed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Shawia dentata typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
